title: Fixed Module Template Missing in Vault Index Gen
details:
ISSUE RESOLVED: The "vault generate-index" command was failing to generate indices for many folders because the "module" template was missing from the template manager.

ROOT CAUSE: The TemplateManager was only loading templates from embedded resources but not from the file system templates directory, causing the "module" template (which existed as a file) to be unavailable.

SOLUTION IMPLEMENTED:
1. Modified TemplateManager.LoadTemplates() method in TemplateManager.cs to load templates from both embedded resources AND file system
2. Added file system template loading logic that scans the templates directory for .yaml files
3. Updated the template loading to merge both sources, with file system templates taking precedence over embedded ones

KEY CHANGES:
- Enhanced LoadTemplates() method to use GetTemplatesFromFileSystem() and GetTemplatesFromEmbeddedResources()
- File system templates are loaded first, then embedded resources are added if not already present
- This ensures all available templates (both embedded and file-based) are accessible

RESULT:
- Command now successfully processes 104 folders instead of mostly skipping them
- "module" template is now found and applied correctly for hierarchy levels 5 and 6
- Zero failures in the vault index generation process
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing embedded templates

FILES MODIFIED:
- src/c-sharp/NotebookAutomation.Core/Services/TemplateManager.cs

This fix ensures that the template system works with both embedded resources (for built-in templates) and file system templates (for custom templates like "module").
